title: Shiny suicide_indicator_r Dashboard
text:
Summary





Shiny suicide_indicator_r Dashboard Usage





This app written in Shiny and Dash analyzes suicide rates and socio-economic factors using data from the World Health Organization. It features interactive maps, bar charts, and line plots to visualize the data by country, gender, age group, and time period. The app allows anyone interested in exploring and analyzing suicide rates to study the trends in order to find measures to mitigate the detrimental effects of such phenomena.

title: The Purpose of an Education Isn’t What You Think it Is
The Purpose of an Education Isn’t What You Think it Is
text:
Summary


The article discusses my personal experience of the Master of Data Science program at the University of British Columbia. It describes my initial excitement for the program, followed by the sudden realization of how challenging it is. It highlights the differences between undergraduate and graduate programs and the difficulty of the workload. In the article, I am recognizing that my experiences may not be as stressful as some of my classmates’ experiences, who are juggling full-time jobs and taking care of their children while studying. The article emphasizes that the purpose of education is not just to learn the course materials but also to train individuals to be motivated problem-solvers.






UBC Vancouver Campus

title: Inferential Study Identifying Factors Associated with Heart Diseases
Inferential Study Identifying Factors Associated with Heart Diseases
text:
Summary





inferential_study_heart_attack Github Repo Structure





The project aimed at determining the relationship between heart disease probability and demographic/health factors such as age, sex, chest pain type, and cholesterol levels. Hypothesis testing was performed using permutation tests for numerical variables like age and electrocardiography (ECG) results such as maximum heart rate achieved and ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest. The Chi-Squared Test was used for categorical variables in contingency table analysis. Results indicated that heart disease patients have higher average age, lower maximum heart rate achieved, and higher ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest compared to non-heart disease patients. Other factors associated with heart disease include sex, chest pain type, exercise-induced angina, slope of the peak exercise ST segment, number of major vessels, and defect type.

title: Dash suicideWatch Dashboard
text:
Summary





suicideWatch Dashboard Sketch





The suicideWatch Dash app provides visualizations and statistics on the number of suicides and suicide rates for different age groups and genders in various countries. The app is primarily targeted towards researchers, policymakers, mental health professionals, and anyone interested in exploring and analyzing suicide rates with interactive capabilities that allow them to study the trends to find measures to mitigate the detrimental effects of such phenomena.

The project identifies factors associated with heart disease by analyzing demographic and health factors using permutation and Chi-Squared tests. By the end of this study age, maximum heart rate achieved, and ST depression induced by exercise were found to be significantly associated with heart disease.

title: Stepan Zaiatc
text:
I’m Stepan (and my last name is pronounced “zah-YAHTS”). I’m currently a Master of Data Science student at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, Canada. My professional experience includes over three years working in various chemistry, microbiology, and clinical laboratories. I’m an aspiring data scientist with a track record of producing high-quality analytical data, and leveraging a diverse skill set in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization.
Currently, I’m seeking to transition knowledge to the field of computational biology and data science. In my spare time, you’ll find me hiking or skiing in the mountains around Vancouver with friends.

title: forxpy & forxr Packages
text: forxpy Code Source  forxpy Pkg   forxr Code Source  forxr Pkg

title: forxpy & forxr Packages
text:
Summary





forxr Package Landing Page





forxpy and forxr are Python and R packages that provide easy access to daily exchange rates and forex conversion. They were created by me and my collaborates at UBC and utilize data from the Bank of Canada. The packages support multiple currencies and provide historical exchange rates. Users can easily make currency conversions with a simple function call, and the packages also allow for the retrieval of historical exchange rates in a chart, making it useful for dashboard building. forxpy and forxr can be useful for various industries that require currency conversions, such as finance and banking, e-commerce, travel and tourism, data analysis, and cryptocurrency. Similar packages include forex-python and CurrencyConverter. forxpy and forxr are released under the terms of the MIT license and welcome all contributions.
